sn38.3:1.2: “Those who teach principles” or “those who teach Dhamma” (dhammavādino).
sn38.3:1.4: “Holy One” (sugata) is a frequent epithet of the Buddha, or as here, for any arahant. Formally, it parallels “Realized One” (tathāgata), i.e. “one who has come to the state of truth”. Sugata therefore means “one who has come to the state of the good/happy/well”. These are past participles; the noun form of the same word is sugati, a “good place” or “heaven”. It is a term primarily associated with Buddhism; in later Sanskrit, followers of the Buddha were called bauddha or saugata.
